block.p: Kirstin L. Schantzenbach, the daughter of Elaine Crocker of New York and William K. Schantzenbach of Lancaster, Pa., was married yesterday to Brandon Hall Sutcliffe, the son of Cathy and S. Lynn Sutcliffe of Bernardsville, N.J. The Rev. Henry Stewart Irvin, an Episcopal priest, officiated at the home of the bride's mother and stepfather, Ralph Crocker, in Weston, Conn.
Mr. and Mrs. Sutcliffe graduated from Bates College, where they met.

Kirstin L. Schantzenbach, the daughter of Elaine Crocker of New York and William K. Schantzenbach of Lancaster, Pa., was married yesterday to Brandon Hall Sutcliffe, the son of Cathy and S. Lynn Sutcliffe of Bernardsville, N.J. The Rev. Henry Stewart Irvin, an Episcopal priest, officiated at the home of the bride's mother and stepfather, Ralph Crocker, in Weston, Conn.
Mr. and Mrs. Sutcliffe graduated from Bates College, where they met.

The bride, 27, received a master's degree in political theory from New York University and will be a second-year law student at Columbia in September. Her mother is the president of Moore Capital Management in New York. Her father is the chief financial officer for the Pennsylvania Employees Benefit Trust Fund in Harrisburg, which manages health benefits for state employees and retirees. Her stepfather is an investment manager. Her stepmother, Donna Ellenberg, is a senior financial consultant in York, Pa., for Merrill Lynch & Company.

The bridegroom, 29, is the vice president for e-commerce and business development of energysolve .com, a new Somerset, N.J., company, which plans to provide energy billing and purchasing services on the Internet. His father is the company's chief executive.
